column1: #Text=Several popular culture references are made in the book to illustrate your experiences .
#Text=You talk about the film Poltergeist and how your husband compared it to his experience of pulling you out of your psychosis ( p. 219 ) .

#Text=You reference the film The Omen as a way to describe L. Ron Hubbard ' s view in a purported version of the Scientology level " OT 8 " that you read on the Internet , writing , " [ Hubbard ] said that he had his next mission lined up that was to come back in a healthy body and join politics - a modern-day Damien from The Omen .

column1: #Text=If it â€™s in your town , do nâ€™t miss it .
#Text=I kept it on my replay for months so I could watch again with friends ( ex Scn or never Scn ) who had missed it .
#Text=I wish the public , especially America , would not be so star struck that they ignore the Human Rights Abuses happening within our own borders ...
#Text=Do you have any thoughts or advice for others either curious to find out more information about Scientology or those seeking to leave the organization ?
#Text=If you are thinking about joining , stick to the internet for a while , a long while â€“ they have their own websites , so you can see both sides .
#Text=For those seeking to leave the Sea Organization , just get up and walk out .
#Text=If they touch you you have a million dollar lawsuit â€“ but how to get the information inside to you ? ? ? ?
#Text=Are there any other points regarding your experiences that you would like to elaborate on or explain ?
#Text=I wish the public , especially America , would not be so star struck that they ignore the Human Rights Abuses happening within our own borders , or just find it too had to believe .

#Text=A friend of mine told a famous actress my story , and she could nâ€™t believe it , come to find out another friend of theirs had reported the same thing and they had simply thought she was delusional .
#Text=Nancy Many , thank you for taking the time to participate in this interview with Wikinews .
